meanings.definition: A long, flexible snout or trunk used for feeding or grasping.
meanings.sent1: The elephant used its proboscis to pick up the peanuts.
meanings.sent2: The anteater's proboscis helped it reach the ants in the anthill.
meanings.sent3: The proboscis of the monkey made it look like it had an extra arm!
meanings.sent4: Her proboscis of curiosity led her to explore the mysterious cave.
meanings.sent5: The proboscis of the vacuum cleaner sucked up all the dirt effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A tubular organ used for sucking or feeding in insects or other invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly's proboscis reached deep into the flower for nectar.
meanings.sent2: The mosquito's proboscis pierced the skin to suck blood.
meanings.sent3: The proboscis of the bee was like a tiny straw for sipping nectar.
meanings.sent4: His proboscis for knowledge led him to read every book in the library.
meanings.sent5: The proboscis of the octopus extended to catch its prey with precision.
